repnme.cdata!:
Nicaragua - Micro, Small and Medium
            Enterprise Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Micro, Small and Medium
            Enterprise Development Project for Nicaragua were as
            follows: outcomes were satisfactory, the risk to development
            outcome was low, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and
            the Borrower performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: technical assistance at the application
            stage leads to greater beneficiary satisfaction and success
            of matching grants programs. Firms led by women and
            indigenous people, as well as other marginalized groups, are
            often those that lack the time and capacity to complete the
            application process and moreover, understand the needs of
            their own business in order to improve.  Given the mixed
            results seen thus far in matching grants programs supported
            by the WBG, it is important to invest in a rigorous impact
            evaluation at the start of a matching grants program in
            order to claim attribution to the project for impacts such
            as job creation and productivity gains. The results of such
            an evaluation can serve as a useful input to government
            policies on future matching grants programs, and lessons
            learned for the WBG in its future operations of such
            programs. The establishment of a Steering Committee within
            the counterpart government can enhance the efficiency of
            project implementation. Such a committee serves as a
            platform and mediating body among sometimes competing or
            unfocused interests within a government and with other stakeholders.

repnme.cdata!:
Nicaragua - Micro, Small, and Medium
            Enterprise Development Project : supervision mission - April
            7 to 11, 2014

abstracts.cdata!:
This Aide Memoire on the Project
            Development of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises for
            Nicaragua reports that the World Bank sent a mission to
            Nicaragua during the week of April 7th 2014. The purpose of
            the visit was: 1) to supervise the execution of the
            activities of the business climate and shared funds; 2) to
            revise the impacts already realized; 3) to discuss the
            closing of the project and the sustainability of the
            impacts. The state of implementation of the project was
            considered satisfactory.
